title: Truffle doesn't decode custom revert error
body:
## Issue / feature request

Can't decode a custom error with truffle develop or console.

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new truffle project and add the following contract. 

  ```solidity
  // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
  pragma solidity >=0.4.22 <0.9.0;

  contract Clue {
    uint public counter = 0;

    error MysteryError(string enigma);

    function poke() public returns (uint) {
      counter += 1;
      if (counter == 1) {
        revert MysteryError({
          enigma: "mu mu mu"
        });
      }
      return counter;
    }
  }
```
1. start truffle develop
  `truffle develop`
1. Compile, instantiate and poke the contract
  - `compile`
  - `clue = await Clue.new()`
  - `await clue.poke({gas: 0xfffff})`
  
## Expected Behavior

The contract should revert and truffle should decode the custom error.

We already have #4123; can this be closed as a duplicate?
